elements.title: throws thousands of currant buns from the roof of the County Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that today, to mark the coronation of Charles III and Camilla, Abingdon Town Council throws thousands of currant buns from the roof of the County Hall (building pictured)?

elements.title: an Iowa TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an Iowa TV station's prior decision to disaffiliate from the Fox network meant that The Simpsons were originally unseen in the Quad Cities?

elements.title: Herman Benson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before his 100th birthday, Herman Benson wrote his own obituary claiming that his "last, dying words" were a plea for generous donations to the Association for Union Democracy?

elements.title: thirty-six collections (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that across his thirty-six collections, fashion designer Alexander McQueen contemplated religion, told fairy tales, and criticized the fashion industry?

elements.title: Martine Froger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Martine Froger was elected to the National Assembly of France without the support of the national leadership of her party?

elements.title: anti-trespass panels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while studies have shown anti-trespass panels do reduce intrusions into rail track areas, there is concern that they could also trap trespassers on the tracks?

elements.title: Soekotjo Sastrodinoto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that under Soekotjo Sastrodinoto, the municipal government of Surabaya signed up the city's homeless population for the transmigration program?

elements.title: There I Ruined It (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that There I Ruined It aims to ruin as many songs as possible?
